scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Street: Monica and Phoebe are walking to a newsstand.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Do you think they have yesterday's daily news?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Just wanna check my horoscope, see if it was right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God. (Grabs Phoebe and turns her away) Phoebe. Don't look now, but behind us is a guy who has the potential to break our hearts and plunge us into a pit of depression.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Where? (Turns to face him) Ooh, come to Momma.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He's coming. Be cool, be cool, be cool.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Nice hat.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (in unison) Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We should do something. Whistle.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We are not going to whistle.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Come on, do it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Do it!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Do it do it do it!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Shouts to the guy) Woo-woo!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I can't believe you did that!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Street: Monica and Phoebe are walking to a newsstand.]

events.event_description: Phoebe asks Monica if the newsstand has yesterday's daily news.
Monica expresses concern about a man behind them who might upset them.
Phoebe turns to face the man behind them and makes a playful comment.
Monica warns Phoebe to stay cool as the man approaches.
The man compliments Phoebe's hat.
Phoebe suggests they should whistle to the man, and Monica refuses.
Phoebe encourages Monica to whistle, and Monica insists she will not.
Phoebe repeatedly urges Monica to whistle, and Monica continues to refuse.
Phoebe shouts 'Woo-woo!' to the approaching man.
Phoebe expresses disbelief that Monica actually whistled at the man.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Hospital, the guy is in a coma and Mon and Pheebs are visiting.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why did I 'woo-hoo'? I mean, what was I hoping would happen? That-that he'd turn round and say 'I love that sound, I must have you now'?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I just wish there was something we could do. (Bends down and talks to him) Hello. Hello, Coma Guy. GET UP, YOU GIRL SCOUT! UP! UP! UP!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Maybe nobody's tried this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I wish we at least knew his name... Look at that face. I mean, even sleeping, he looks smart. I bet he's a lawyer.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but did you see the dents in his knuckles? That means he's artistic.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, he's a lawyer, who teaches sculpting on the side. And- he can dance!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! And, he's the kinda guy who, when you're talking, he's listening, y'know, and not saying 'Yeah, I understand' but really wondering what you look like naked.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I wish all guys could be like him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Hospital, the guy is in a coma and Mon and Pheebs are visiting.]

events.event_description: Monica questions her motives for making a woo-hoo sound, wondering if she hoped the coma patient would respond positively.
Phoebe talks to the coma patient, greeting him and encouraging him to get up.
Monica expresses concern about not knowing the patient's name and comments on his appearance, speculating he might be a lawyer.
Phoebe observes the dents in the patient's knuckles and suggests he might be artistic.
Monica guesses the patient is a lawyer who teaches sculpting and can dance.
Phoebe speculates that the patient is attentive and genuinely interested when others speak, not just pretending to listen.
Monica expresses a wish that all men could be like the patient.
Phoebe agrees with Monica's sentiment about the patient's qualities.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe are telling everyone about their coma
guy.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Are there no conscious men in the city for you two?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He doesn't have anyone.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, we-we feel kinda responsible.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I can't believe you said woowoo. I don't even say woowoo.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, she's coming up! She's coming up! (Turns on the TV)

dialogue.speaker: JAY LENO
dialogue.text: (on TV) Folks, when we come back we'll be talking about her new book, '

dialogue.speaker: EUPHORIA UNBOUND'
dialogue.text: the always interesting Nora Tyler Bing. You might wanna put the kids to bed for this one.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, we don't have to watch this. Weekend At Bernie's is on Showtime , HBO , and Cinemax .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No way, forget it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: C'mon, she's your mom!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Exactly. Weekend At Bernie's ! Dead guy getting hit in the groin twenty, thirty times! No?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Chandler, I gotta tell you, I love your mom's books! I love her books! I cannot get on a plane without one! I mean, this is so cool!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, you wouldn't think it was cool if you're eleven years old and all your friends are passing around page 79 of 'Mistress Bitch.'

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: C'mon, Chandler, I love your mom. I think she's a blast.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You can say that because she's not your mom.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, please...

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Bona sera.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, hi sweetie. (They kiss)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: When did Rigatoni get back from Rome?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Last night.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, so then his plane didn't explode in a big ball of fire?... Just a dream I had- but, phew.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey hey hey! She's on!

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Ah! Nora Bing!

dialogue.speaker: JAY LENO
dialogue.text: (on TV) ...Now what is this about you-you being arrested i-in London? What is that all about?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Your mom was arrested?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Shhh, busy beaming with pride.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: (on TV) ...This is kind of embarrassing, but occasionally after I've been intimate with a man...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Now why would she say that's embarrassing?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Shhh.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: (on TV) ...I just get this craving for Kung Pow Chicken.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: THAT'S TOO MUCH INFORMATION!!

dialogue.speaker: JAY LENO
dialogue.text: (on TV) Alright, so now you're doing this whole book tour thing, how is that going?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: (on TV) Oh, fine. I'm leaving for New York tomorrow, which I hate- but I get to see my son, who I love...

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Awww!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: This is the way that I find out. Most moms use the phone.

dialogue.speaker: JAY LENO
dialogue.text: (on TV) Y'know, don't take this wrong, I-I just don't see you a-as a mom, somehow.. I don't mean that, I don't mean that bad...

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: (on TV) Oh no, I am a fabulous mom! I bought my son his first condoms.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...And then he burst into flames.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe are telling everyone about their coma
guy.]

events.event_description: Monica and Phoebe discuss feeling responsible for the coma guy.
Rachel turns on the TV to watch a segment about Nora Tyler Bing.
Jay Leno on TV introduces Nora Tyler Bing and mentions her new book.
Chandler comments on the availability of 'Weekend At Bernie's' on multiple channels.
Rachel expresses enthusiasm about her mom's books and their importance when traveling.
Ross inquires about Rigatoni's return from Rome.
Phoebe announces that Nora Bing is on TV.
Jay Leno questions Nora Bing about her arrest in London.
Mrs. Bing admits on TV to craving Kung Pow Chicken after intimacy.
Mrs. Bing states she is leaving for New York and expresses love for her son.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, it's a montage of Monica and Phoebe's visit to the hospital with My
Guy playing in the background.  It starts with Monica reading a newspaper to
him.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let's see. Congress is debating a new deficit reduction bill... the mayor wants to raise subway fares again... the high today was forty-five... and- oh, teams played sports.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What about Glen? He could be a Glen.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nah... not-not special enough.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh! How about Agamemnon?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Waaay too special.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, it's a montage of Monica and Phoebe's visit to the hospital with My
Guy playing in the background.  It starts with Monica reading a newspaper to
him.]

events.event_description: Monica reads a newspaper aloud, discussing current political and sports news.
Phoebe suggests that Glen could be a suitable name for the baby.
Monica dismisses the name Glen as not special enough.
Phoebe proposes the name Agamemnon for the baby.
Monica rejects the name Agamemnon as too special.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Mexican Restaurant, Monica, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler and his mom are there.]

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: I am famished. What do I want... (Looks at Chandler's menu)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Please God don't let it be Kung Pow Chicken.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Oh, you watched the show! What'd you think?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I think you need to come out of your shell just a little.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Entering) What is this dive? Only you could've picked this place.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Oooh, c'mon, shut up, it's fun. Gimme a hug. (They both sit down) Well, I think we're ready for some tequila.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know I am.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Who's doing shots?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm in.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: There y'go. Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, I'm not really a shot drinking kinda guy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi! Sorry- sorry we're late, we, uh, kinda just, y'know, lost track of time.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...But a man can change. (Downs a shot)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Anyone want me to appraise anything?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mrs. Bing, I have to tell you, I've read everything you've ever written. No, I mean it! I mean, when I read Euphoria at Midnight, all I wanted to do was become a writer.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Oh, please, honey, listen, if I can do it, anybody can. You just start with half a dozen European cities, throw in thirty euphemisms for male genitalia, and bam! You have got yourself a book.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Myyy mother, ladies and gentlemen.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Yeah, any messages for room 226?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: You okay there, slugger?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm fine, I'm fine. (A woman emerges from the toilet behind him and he tries to pretend he was in the other one)

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: What is with you tonight?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nothing. Nothing nothing nothing.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: (To phone) Okay, thank you. (To Ross) It's the Italian Hand-Licker, isn't it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No. It's the one he's licking.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: She's supposed to be with you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're good.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Oh, Ross, listen to me. I have sold a hundred million copies of my books, and y'know why?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The girl on the cover with her nipples showing?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: No. Because I know how to write men that women fall in love with. Believe me, I cannot sell a Paolo. People will not turn three hundred twenty-five pages for a Paolo. C'mon, the guy's a secondary character, a, y'know, complication you eventually kill off.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: When?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: He's not a hero. ...You know who our hero is.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The guy on the cover with his nipples showing?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: No, it's you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Please.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: No, really, c'mon. You're smart, you're sexy...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: You are gonna be fine, believe me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh-oh...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uhhhh.... I'll just pee in the street.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Mexican Restaurant, Monica, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler and his mom are there.]

events.event_description: Mrs. Bing expresses her hunger and looks at Chandler's menu.
Chandler hopes Mrs. Bing does not order Kung Pow Chicken.
Mrs. Bing comments on watching a show and asks Chandler what he thought.
Chandler advises Mrs. Bing to come out of her shell.
Ross enters the scene and questions the choice of the restaurant.
Mrs. Bing defends the restaurant and asks Chandler for a hug.
Mrs. Bing suggests they are ready for tequila shots.
Ross declines to do shots, stating he's not a shot drinker.
Rachel apologizes for their late arrival and explains they lost track of time.
Ross, after drinking a shot, comments that a man can change.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, the next morning. Joey is getting the door in his dressing
gown—it's Ross.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, is Chandler here?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, uh, about last night, um, Chandler.. you didn't tell... (Joey shakes his head) Okay, 'cause I'm thinking- we don't need to tell Chandler, I mean, it was just a kiss, right? One kiss? No big deal? Right?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Right. No big deal.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: In Bizarro World!! You broke the code!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What code?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You don't kiss your friend's mom! Sisters are okay, maybe a hot-lookin' aunt... but not a mom, never a mom!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you guys doing out here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh.. uh.. Well, Joey and I had discussed getting in an early morning racquetball game. But, um, apparently, somebody overslept.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, you don't have your racket.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no I don't, because it's being restrung, somebody was supposed to bring me one.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, well you didn't call and leave your grip size.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, you guys spend waaaay too much time together. (Goes back inside and shuts the door)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, I'm scum, I'm scum.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ross, how could you let this happen?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know, God, I... well, it's not like she's a regular mom, y'know? She's, she's sexy, she's...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You don't think my mom's sexy?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well... not in the same way...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'll have you know that Gloria Tribbiani was a handsome woman in her day, alright? You think it's easy giving birth to seven children?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, I think we're getting into a weird area here...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What're you guys doing out here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, not playing raquetball!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He forgot to leave his grip size!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He didn't get the goggles!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well,sounds like you two have issues.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Goodbye, baby.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Ciao, bela.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Do they wait for me to do this?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So are you gonna tell him?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why would I tell him?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How about 'cause if you don't, his mother might.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Entering) What are you guys doing here?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uhhhh.... he's not even wearing a jockstrap!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...What did I ask?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, the next morning. Joey is getting the door in his dressing
gown—it's Ross.]

events.event_description: Joey answers the door in his dressing gown and confirms Chandler is present.
Ross asks Joey if Chandler is there and discusses last night's kiss.
Ross suggests they don't need to tell Chandler about the kiss, implying it was a secret.
Joey agrees with Ross that the kiss was no big deal.
Ross and Joey discuss the 'code' of not kissing a friend's mom.
Chandler questions what Ross and Joey are doing outside and enters the scene.
Ross admits they were planning to play racquetball but lack equipment.
Joey criticizes Ross for not bringing his racquet's grip size.
Ross laments that his racquet is being restrung and he doesn't have his goggles.
Rachel comments on Ross and Joey's issues, implying they are overreacting.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Hospital. Phoebe is there stroking Coma Guy's hair, when Monica enters with a
bunch of balloons.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Nothing, I just thought I'd stop by.. y'know, after the uh... that I.. y'know, so what are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm not really here. Just thought I'd drop these off...on the way.. my way... Do you come here a lot? Without me?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No. (Monica brushes Coma Guy's hair in the other direction) No! No! ...So, um, do you think he's doing any better than he was this morning?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How would I know? I-I wasn't here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Really? Not even to, um, change his PAJAMAS?! (Whips back the sheet to reveal him wearing new pajamas.)

scenes.location: Hospital. Phoebe is there stroking Coma Guy's hair
scenes.context_label: 0111_scene_006_Hospital. Phoebe is there stroking Coma Guy's hair
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Hospital. Phoebe is there stroking Coma Guy's hair, when Monica enters with a
bunch of balloons.]

events.event_description: Phoebe strokes Coma Guy's hair while sitting beside him in the hospital bed.
Monica enters the hospital room carrying a bunch of balloons.
Monica greets Phoebe with a hello.
Phoebe responds to Monica's greeting with a hello.
Monica asks Phoebe what she is doing in the hospital.
Phoebe explains she stopped by after a previous unspecified event.
Monica questions whether Phoebe comes to the hospital often without her.
Phoebe denies that she comes to the hospital often.
Phoebe asks Monica if the patient is doing better than earlier that morning.
Monica responds that she does not know because she was not there earlier.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross is talking to Chandler. Joey is making a snack at the
bar.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're my friend. I-I had to tell you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't believe it. Paolo kissed my mom?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, um, I don't know if you noticed, but he had a lot to drink, and you know how he gets when he's drun..uh... (He has caught sight of Joey scowling at him) I can't do this, I did it, it was me, I'm sorry, I kissed your mom.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I was really upset about Rachel and Paolo, and I think I had too much tequila, and Nora- um, Mrs. Mom- your Bing- was just being nice, y'know, and- But nothing happened, nothing- Ask Joey, Joey, uh, came in-

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (To Joey) You knew about this?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh... y'know, knowledge is a tricky thing.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I spent the entire day with you, why didn't you tell me?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, hey, hey, you're lucky I caught them when I did, or else who knows what woulda happened.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks, man, big help.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (To Ross) I can't believe this! What the hell were you thinking?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I wasn't- I mean, I-

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, of all my friends, no-one knows the crap I go through with my mom more than you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know-

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't believe you did this. (Walks toward the door)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Chandler-

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Me neither, y'know what-

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm still mad at you for not telling me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are you mad at me for?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Chandler-

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You gotta let me slam the door! (Leaves; slams the door)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Shouting after him) Chandler, I didn't kiss her, he did! (To Ross) See what happens when you break the code?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Joey-

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah! (Points to door) Huh? (Leaves and slams the door)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross is talking to Chandler. Joey is making a snack at the
bar.]

events.event_description: Ross confesses to Chandler that he kissed Chandler's mom, Nora, while drunk.
Joey admits to Chandler that he knew about Ross's kiss but did not tell him.
Chandler expresses disbelief and anger towards Ross for not telling him about the kiss.
Chandler confronts Joey about why he didn't tell him earlier.
Chandler walks toward the door and slams it in anger.
Joey shouts after Chandler, clarifying that Ross was the one who kissed Chandler's mom.
Joey leaves the scene and slams the door after shouting.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there except for Chandler.  Rachel is writing
something and Monica walks up.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Reading) 'A Woman Undone, by Rachel Karen Green'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Thought I'd give it a shot. I'm still on the first chapter. Now, do you think his 'love stick can be liberated from its denim prison'?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Reads) Yeah, I'd say so. And there's no 'j' in 'engorged'.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Walks up with her guitar) Hey Rach.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Going to the hospital tonight?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You just asked me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, maybe it was a trick question. (Plays a few chords) Um, Rachel can we do this now?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. (Writes a little more) I am so hot!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (To Ross, on the couch) Now, here's a picture of my mother and father on their wedding day. Now you tell me she's not a knockout.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I cannot believe we're having this conversation.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: C'mon! Just try to picture her not pregnant, that's all.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Into microphone) Central Perk is proud to present Miss Phoebe Buffay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thanks. Hi, um, 'kay. I'd like to start with a song that's about a man that I recently met, who's, um, come to be very important to me. (Monic

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Into mike) Okay, that was Phoebe Buffay, everybody. Woo!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What was that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, Phoebe just started a...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I believe I was talking to Joey, alright there, Mother-Kisser? (Goes to the counter)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Laughing) Mother-Kisser... (Sees Ross's look) I'll shut up.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Chandler, can I just say something? I-I know you're still mad at me, I just wanna say that there were two people there that night. Okay? Two sets of lips.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, well, I expect this from her. Okay? She's always been a Freudian nightmare.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, well, if she always behaves like this, why don't you say something?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Because it's complicated, it's complex- Hey, you kissed my mom!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (To the rest of Central Perk) We're rehearsing a Greek play.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's very funny. We done now?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No! Okay, you mean, you're not gonna talk to her, you're not gonna tell her how you feel?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That would be no. Look, just because you played tonsil tennis with my mom doesn't mean you know her. Alright? Trust me, you can't talk to her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, 'you' can't, or (Points to Chandler) you can't? (Chandler grabs his finger) Okay, that's my finger. (Chandler twists it and Ross goes down on one knee) That's, that's my knee. (To Central Perk) Still doing the play. Aaah!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there except for Chandler.  Rachel is writing
something and Monica walks up.]

events.event_description: Rachel writes the title 'A Woman Undone, by Rachel Karen Green' in her notebook.
Monica reads Rachel’s notebook aloud, commenting on the content.
Rachel asks Monica if a phrase in her writing suggests liberation of a 'love stick' from denim.
Monica reads Rachel’s writing and comments on the absence of the letter 'j' in the word 'engorged'.
Phoebe walks up to Rachel with her guitar and greets her.
Joey shows Ross a photograph of his parents on their wedding day and comments on his mother’s appearance.
Joey suggests imagining his mother not pregnant to emphasize her attractiveness.
Phoebe introduces her song about a man she recently met at Central Perk.
Rachel announces over the microphone that Phoebe Buffay is performing.
Chandler questions what Phoebe is doing and then moves to the counter.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, Monica bursts in, closely followed by Phoebe. There is no
sign of Coma Guy.  His bed is empty.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Alright, whadyou do with him?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh! You're awake!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Look at you! How, how do you feel?

dialogue.speaker: COMA GUY
dialogue.text: Uh, a little woozy, but basically okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You look good!

dialogue.speaker: COMA GUY
dialogue.text: I feel good! ...Who are you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm Phoebe Buffay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm Monica Geller. I've been taking care of you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, we both have.

dialogue.speaker: COMA GUY
dialogue.text: So, the Etch-a-Sketch is from you guys?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, actually it's just from me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I got you the foot massager.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know who shaved you? That was me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I read to you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I sang. (To Monica) Hah!

dialogue.speaker: COMA GUY
dialogue.text: Well,... thanks.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, my pleasure.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You're welcome.

dialogue.speaker: COMA GUY
dialogue.text: So. I guess I'll see you around.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What, that's it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: "See you around?"

dialogue.speaker: COMA GUY
dialogue.text: Well, what do you want me to say?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I don't know. Maybe, um, "That was nice?" Admit something to me? "I'll call you?"

dialogue.speaker: COMA GUY
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll call you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don't think you mean that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This is so typical. Y'know, we give, and we give, and we give. And then- we just get nothing back! And then one day, y'know, it's just, you wake up, and "See you around!" Let's go, Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know what? We thought you were different. But I guess it was just the coma.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, Monica bursts in, closely followed by Phoebe. There is no
sign of Coma Guy.  His bed is empty.]

events.event_description: Monica bursts into the hospital room, followed closely by Phoebe, noticing the bed is empty.
Coma Guy, lying in the hospital bed, responds that he feels 'a little woozy, but basically okay'.
Monica comments that Coma Guy looks good.
Coma Guy asks who Monica and Phoebe are.
Monica introduces herself to Coma Guy, saying she has been taking care of him.
Phoebe introduces herself to Coma Guy.
Monica mentions giving Coma Guy a foot massager, and Phoebe mentions shaving him and reading to him.
Coma Guy thanks Monica and Phoebe for their care.
Coma Guy indicates he will call Monica and Phoebe when he sees them again.
Monica and Phoebe express disappointment and leave the scene after Coma Guy's departure.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's Chandler is talking with his mom.]

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Car's waiting downstairs, I just wanted to drop off these copies of my book for your friends. Anything you want from Lisbon?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, just knowing you're gonna be there is enough.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Alright, well, be good, I love you. (Kisses him and goes to leave)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You kissed my best Ross! ...Or something to that effect.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: (Reentering) O-kay. Look, it, it was stupid.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Really stupid.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Really stupid. And I don't even know how it happened. I'm sorry, honey, I promise it will never happen again. Are we okay now?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. No. No...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, the forbidden love of a man and his door.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Shh. He did it. He told her off, and not just about the kiss, about everything.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're kidding.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, no. He said "When are you gonna grow up and start being a mom?"

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Then she came back with "The question is, when are you gonna grow up and realise I have a bomb?"

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 'Kay, wait a minute, are you sure she didn't say "When are you gonna grow up and realise I am your mom?"

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That makes more sense.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, what's going on now?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I dunno, I've been standing here spelling it out for you! (Goes back to the door) I don't hear anything. Oh, wait, wait, wait. (Looks through the spyhole)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whaddya see?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hard to tell, they're so tiny and upside-down. Wait, wait. They're walking away... they're walking away... No, no they're not, they're coming right at us! Run! Run!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: You okay, kiddo?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Alright. (Kisses him)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nice save.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Very politely) Mrs. Bing.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. BING
dialogue.text: Mr. Geller.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You mean that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, why not. (They shake hands) So I told her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah? How'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Awful. Awful. Couldn'ta gone worse.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, howdya feel?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Pretty good! I told her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, see? So, maybe it wasn't such a bad idea, y'know, me kissing your mom, uh? Huh? (Wags his finger at Chandler, then puts it down) But.. we don't have to go down that road.

scenes.location: Chandler and Joey's Chandler is talking with his mom.
scenes.context_label: 0111_scene_010_Chandler and Joey's Chandler is talking with his mom.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's Chandler is talking with his mom.]

events.event_description: Mrs. Bing informs Chandler that the car is waiting downstairs and offers to bring him copies of her book from Lisbon.
Mrs. Bing kisses Chandler goodbye and leaves the scene.
Chandler comments on Mrs. Bing's kiss, jokingly saying she kissed his best Ross.
Mrs. Bing reenters and apologizes for her previous kiss, calling it stupid and expressing uncertainty about how it happened.
Chandler and Mrs. Bing agree that the kiss was stupid and that it will not happen again.
Ross comments on the situation, sarcastically referring to it as 'the forbidden love of a man and his door.'
Joey observes that Chandler told Mrs. Bing off about the kiss and other issues, implying Chandler was assertive.
Joey and Ross speculate about what Mrs. Bing said to Chandler, with Joey describing her return and their conversation.
Joey looks through the spyhole and reports that Chandler and Mrs. Bing are walking away, then they come back towards the door, causing Joey to urge everyone to run.
Chandler and Mrs. Bing exchange kisses and greetings after she reenters, and Chandler comments on her save.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is handing out copies of her book to the gang.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Now this is just the first chapter, and I want your absolute honest opinion. Oh, oh, and on page two, he's not 'reaching for her heaving beasts'.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's a 'niffle'?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You usually find them on the 'heaving beasts'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Alright, alright, so I'm not a great typist...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wait, did you get to the part about his 'huge throbbing pens'? Tell ya, you don't wanna be around when he starts writing with those!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Alright, that's it! Give it back! That's it!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Nooo!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is handing out copies of her book to the gang.]

events.event_description: Rachel hands out copies of her book to Monica, Ross, and Joey.
Rachel asks the gang for honest opinions on the first chapter of her book.
Rachel comments on a humorous typo in her book regarding page two.
Monica asks Rachel what a 'niffle' is.
Joey jokes that 'niffle' is found on 'heaving beasts'.
Ross makes a humorous comment about a part in the book involving 'huge throbbing pens'.
Rachel demands the book back from the gang, indicating frustration.
The gang collectively protests Rachel's demand to take back the book.
